result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan L I Yarn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Court to apply 2 days credit ($100.00 total) to costs. Cash bail applied to costs. Costs paid in full. Balance to be refunded to poster.

-Case 22TR1408 is dismissed and read-in. 
**Court orders firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for Wisconsin State Patrol Southeast.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan L I Yarn

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Justin Griffis advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

8:34 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Jordan L I Yarn in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. appeared by Zoom video for Jordan L I Yarn.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes that it received a letter from Atty. Herbers this morning requesting to appear by zoom for the hearing today due to illness.  Court has granted that request but wants to confirm with the defendant that he is comfortable proceeding today with his attorney appearing by Zoom.  Defendant advises he wants to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  Court recites the offer as listed in the pretrial offer.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Count 2 be dismissed and read in.  Court also orders that case 22TR1408 be dismissed and read into this case.  

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Herbers. 
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for Wisconsin State Patrol Southeast Region/Waukesha.

COSTS: $243.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: Court to apply 2 Days Credit, $100.00 AND the $500.00 Cash Bail on Deposit; any remaining bail to be refunded to the poster.  **PAID IN FULL**
Filed unsigned by the defendant.
Filed by Atty. Herbers requesting to appear by Zoom for the Plea and sentencing on 10/12/22 at 8:30.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is able to have firearms lock up at his house.  Defendant can not go armed.

9:02 AM; Case called for Jury status hearing. Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jordan L I Yarn in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Jordan L I Yarn.  Court notes this matter is set for trial next week and inquires as to the status.  Atty. Herbers provides an update; he notes the offer is contingent on his client completing an AODA assessment, his client needs additional time to complete that.  Atty. Herbers is asking the matter be removed form the trial calendar and set for plea and sentencing the week on October 10th.  Atty. Thompson notes the State is prepared to proceed to trial next week, but notes they did provide an updated offer to defense counsel Sunday so they have no objection to defense's request.  Court is inclined to grant the request to adjourn the jury trial but would more than likely modify bail to cash.  Atty. Herbers takes a moment to discuss that with his client; Atty. Herbers advises that he is asking the court to take no action with respect to bail but if the court is inclined to modify bail he is asking it be set at no more than $100.00.  On its own motion the Court will order bail be modified to a $500.00 cash bond; all conditions to remain as previously set.  Court will cancel the 9/27/2022 jury trial and will adjourn for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions filed.
State's Motion in Limine filed.
filed by the defense
Trial Order signed by Judge Paul F Reilly August 11, 2022.

Jury status hearing on September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:49 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Jordan L I Yarn did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Herbers provides an update, he is asking the matter be set for a jury trial and should take 1 day.  Court adjourns for jury status and jury trial.  Court to prepare and sign a pretrial order.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:30 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Jordan L I Yarn did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Herbers provides an update, he needs additional time to try to resolve the matter.  Atty. Herbers is requesting one more further proceedings date. No comment from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is able to have firearms lock up at his house.  Defendant can not go armed.

09:43 AM Defendant Jordan L I Yarn in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
